page.title: 01Land South of St. Fergus
page.content:
Uninspiring countryside, dreary and stark like the weather. Highest point is 45m but reduces to 5m above sea level. Poor grassland leads to sand dunes and a clean sweeping beach. Two farmers own most of the arable land, cropping wheat and barley mostly.
Sparsely populated, the people live in tied houses or small settlements of new properties. These pop up along the secondary roads, where farmers have sold off plots or delapitated crofts have benefited from local government improvement grants. People farm or commute to the nearby gas plant, or Peterhead working in service industries. No recreational amenities exist.
